data.title: Barcelona Global International council
data.meta_description:
To respond to Barcelona's international interest, we have built a network of top professionals 
who have strong ties with Barcelona.
data.text:
Nacho Abia is an Executive Officer and serves as Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Olympus Corporation. Nacho’s career with Olympus started in 2001 as the Managing Director of the Iberia Region based in Barcelona, Spain. He later moved to Hamburg (Germany) in 2007, and to Center Valley, Pennsylvania, in 2011 to join Olympus Corporation of the Americas (OCA). In 2013, he was promoted to the role of President of the entire OCA and in March 2015 was also appointed as its CEO and he served in that capacity until his promotion to the global COO role in April 2020. In addition to his Olympus responsibilities, Nacho serves on the Board of Directors of AdvaMed (Advanced Medical Technology Association) and on the Board of Directors of the US-Spain Chamber of Commerce. Prior to joining Olympus, Nacho held several positions in the IT and consumer electronics industries working for a variety of high-tech companies, including Sony and Techdata. He holds dual Master’s Degrees; one in Telecommunications and Electronic Engineering, and another in Business Administration.

Lawyer admitted in Paris and Barcelona. Working in business law (corporate commercial) in Paris for over 20 years. He is a partner of the law firm M & B lawyers in Paris. He is in the department of commercial law and contracts, advising on economic law, corporate law and commercial litigation. Previously he was a partner of Gide Loyrette Nouel in charge of the Iberian Desk. He was in charge of Investment Advice and Defence and litigation in France for Spanish and Latin American multinationals in industrial and commercial projects. He was also managing partner of Cuatrecasas' Paris office in the corporate M&A and commercial law department. She holds a degree in law from the University of the Basque Country, a master's degree in international trade and law and a higher diploma in commercial law from the University of Paris Panthéon-Sorbonne. She completed her training at IESE with a special program in Leadership in the Legal Profession.

I was born in Barcelona 40 years ago. Since a child I was exposed to international experiences and languages. I am an open minded person and my secret power is opening doors and building long lasting relationships. Studying Chinese at the early age of 18 years old brought me to China in 2005 when China was "the factory of the world". I had an Asian adventure for 9 years, going back to Mainland in 2011.

Businesswoman and fashion designer, specialized in the bridal field. She founded the company in 1995 and has managed to turn it into a holding company with 3 centers of activity in Spain and subsidiaries in the USA, Brazil, Mexico, Canada, Portugal, France and Germany, from where it manages the production and distribution of its 16 bridal collections and 4 party collections to 82 countries and more than 4,000 points of sale.

I am a Telecommunications Engineer from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia, with experience abroad (Australia), on a research project in new technologies. Nowadays I work at Deloitte, in the Fraud and Financial Crime department as an analyst. Despite being at the beginning of my professional career, I consider myself a very ambitious person with big goals.

Consultant at the United Nations in New York. She obtained her degree in Law at Esade and worked for several years as a criminal lawyer in Barcelona. In 2014 she moved to the US to pursue a Master’s degree in Public Policy at NYU and an internship at the UN. After, she worked as a Risk and Forensic Analyst at Interpublic Group of Companies.

In 2006, cofounded my first company: Cocosoft Barcelona, and launched several Internet platforms for business, now, every day, hundreds of companies and thousands of users are using those tools. In 2014 cofounded Kompyte, a competitor tracking that enables Sales teams to win more deals In 2022 we got acquired by Semrush (NYSE: SEMR) and now I'm the COO & CPO of the Kompyte Unit

Born in Barcelona, where he grew up, studied in the French Lycée and later graduated at ESADE Business School with an MBA in 1986. During his professional career, Narcís de Carreras has always worked in the Energy and Infrastructure fields, with a variety of roles in banking, consulting, engineering and utilities sectors. Since 2006 he works for Naturgy Energy Group (formerly known as Gas Natural

Prof. de Lecea graduated in Biology at the University of Barcelona in 1991 and conducted postdoctoral work at The Scripps Research Institute in La Jolla, CA. He started his laboratory on the neurobiology of sleep in 1996. He is best known for his discovery of neurotransmitters critical for the regulation of vigilance states and for the implementation of ontogenetic methods.

Co-founder and President — Cooperativa d’Alumnes Les Oliveres SCCL November 2011 — August 2013 The largest student cooperative in Catalonia with more than 100 students. Our goal was to promote entrepreneurship and solidarity among students. Being part of the first executive team of the cooperative allowed me to get an insight of how to scale and design the whole structure. Managed a budget of around €20K in order to maintain a school in Cameroon – teacher’s wages, utilities bills... –. FX Associate — Kantox June 2015 — September 2015 Kantox is a pioneering firm in the FX market (Foreign Exchange). During my stay at Kantox, my main tasks were: • Developing FX proposals for Kantox's clients in order to establish risk management policies and handle FX operations in the most optimal way. Worked in projects for top clients with special operational needs, directly reporting to the CEO & COO Co-Founder – Impact.Barcelona Think Tank February 2016 - Present We are a non-profit organisation founded by young people that promotes entrepreneurship and ideas development among young people. Partnerships with Mobile World Capital & Barcelona Global. Co-Founder & CFO — Arkyne Technologies (Bioo) October 2015 – Present Responsible of the business and financial development of Arkyne Technologies. Arkyne is a pioneering cleantech company that develops and commercialises technologies capable of generating electricity from plant’s photosynthesis in a competitive and sustainable way. Key Milestones: • Best Business Initiative in Catalonia. • 1st Investment Round: 311.000€ (250.000€ from private investors + 60.000€ loan from ENISA) • Forbes 30 under 30.

Ruben Diaz-Plaja is Senior Policy Advisor in the Policy Planning Unit of the NATO Secretary General and has more than a decade's worth of experience working on the links between security, defence and governance in Europe and its neighbourhood, having worked with NATO, the OSCE and civil society. Ruben is a proud Barcelonan by birth and is committed to helping his city thrive in the years to come.

I moved to Seattle in February 2018, and since then, I have held different product leadership positions at Microsoft, BlueVoyant, and Amazon, where I am currently leading the development of new advertising products and features. Before that, I lived in 7 different cities across the globe, and worked in several companies, including McKinsey, ArcelorMittal, P&G, Google, and a startup.

I started my career at BCG (in Barcelona), where I joined right after completing my BBA and Masters program at ESADE. Half way through my 10+ year journey, I moved to the San Francisco office. In the last few years at BCG I was a Partner in Consumer Technology and Retail, focused on AI, data, and digital transformation. In 2020 I joined Facebook, where I lead the Commerce Business Group.

Partner at REBER law firm in Zurich. After finishing his law studies in Basel and Madrid, he worked for large international law firms both in Spain and Switzerland. He has broad experience in cross-border legal work. He served for almost 20 years as Vice-President and Member of the Executive Committee of the Official Swiss-Spanish Chamber of Commerce and is a lecturer within the Masters Program in International Advocacy of ISDE Madrid.

Born in Barcelona in 1981, and educated in UB in Business Administration and Management, I have always had a great interest in learning about other countries and cultures, which has led me to live in Brazil, Switzerland and the United Kingdom where I developed my professional career in different companies and in different positions. Currently, I am leading the digital transformation practice in BackOffice Associates LLC.

I am an economist with a degree from the Universitat de Barcelona. My professional career is in the financial sector; first in investment banking as a fixed income analyst for emerging markets (Eastern Europe and Middle East) to Dresdner Kleinwort and Commerzbank in London. I am currently the head of the Emerging Markets fixed income research team at the manager of the Swiss bank Union Bancaire Privée.

Director of the National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art of the Republic of Korea. He holds a degree in Philosophy and Sciences of Education by the University of Barcelona. He served as Director of MACBA, Chief Curator at MACBA, Director of TABAKALERA in Donostia-San Sebastián, director of Witte de With in Rotterdam, Curator at IVAM in Valencia and Curator of Exhibitions at the Fondation pour l’Architecture in Brussels.

Global Client Advisor of WPP. Previously Gustavo was the Global President of JWT Worldwide. With a PhD in Economics from the University of Barcelona, he started working in advertising in 1992, in S&S and McCann Erickson Spain. In 2000, he was hired by Ogilvy as President for Argentina, then acted as Regional Director of Multinational clients. In 2006 he was appointed Regional COO based inf Mexico City, then in New York.

Founder and Director of the gallery Ana Mas Projects, based since 2015 in L’Hospitalet de Llobregat (Barcelona) and in San Juan (Puerto Rico). Her career as a gallery director started in 2003 with the creation, in Barcelona, of masArt Gallery. In 2015, she initiated a new project: opening a new gallery in San Juan to aim the establishment of a dialogue between artists from the local scene and Spanish.

As the Founder and Managing Partner of First Venturing I grew the boutique consulting and training firm focused on corporate innovation to a full-time team of three and a network of 100+ collaborators employed on a per-project-basis by serving customers in Spain, Italy, France and Germany. First Venturing has achieved to design and implement the highest valued training programs in a company’s history in four different organizations.

Santi Moix lives in New York since 1986. A multifaceted creator, Moix also makes sculptures, drawings, ceramics and mural paintings as well as illustrations for books. Those medias, along with painting shape his way of expression mixing figuration with abstraction. In 2002, Moix was recognized with a grant from the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation. His graphic work is shown with Pace Gallery. His latest special projects include a mural for Prada in their SoHo store, interventions at the Brooklyn Museum, Palau de la Música Catalana of Barcelona, and the frescoes in the church of Sant Victor of Seurí in the Pyrenees. Currently, Moix resides and has a studio in Brooklyn, New York and in Barcelona.

I am an experienced client adviser. My focus and skills in data analytics support an informed and strategic conversation with my clients in their journey towards Gender Equality in the Workplace. I have an international working and academic background from my time at Deloitte Consulting, as well as my Degree in Economics from UPF along with an Exchange Program at Sciences Po-Paris.

Felipe is a Co-Founder of Stoneshield, a EUR1.0bn AuM Iberian asset manager, where he serves as Managing Partner of the Firm. Previously he was a partner at the Lone Star Funds where he bought, managed and sold assets in excess of €4.0bn. He currently sits on the boards of Neinor Homes and Esmalglass. Felipe is co-founder and trustee of Empieza x Educar, a leading organization in addressing the educational inequities in Spain, which has impacted over 25,000 children over the past 10 years. Felipe was educated at Georgetown University

After a first degree in Geography I successfully combined a PhD on Geography with a Medical degree followed by a post-doc fellowship at the University of Saint Andrews. I completed my education with a speciality in Internal and General Medicine in Switzerland. Nowadays I am the Head of Medical and Rescue at the Federation Internationale de l'Automobobile (FIA) in Geneva.

I started my career as a designer in Barcelona before moving to New York to do a Master’s in Entrepreneurship. Upon returning to Barcelona I built a design consultancy agency before founding my own Startup called Icebergs. My company was acquired by Pinterest and moved to San Francisco to work as the Executive Creative Director of Product Design. I currently head the Pinterest innovation team

My first years as a professional were surrounded by entrepreneurs and their startups, solving finance, supply chain and data challenges. At the moment, I am exploring the other end of the spectrum at PwC UK, where I look for the right path to enable the growth of its business with data.

Member of the Board Director of Rosa Gres in Barcelona, Sabadell Consumer & Finnance Bank in Sabadell and First Horizon Bank in Memphis, Tennessee. She is also a member of the Cultural Affairs Council of Miami-Dade County. She has a degree in Business Administration from the University of Barcelona and was the Founder and Chairman of the Board of Iberia Tiles. ( 1980- 2013)

Mireia Vilanova is a Barcelona-born, LA-based producer. She began her career as an unscripted producer at Barça TV, FC Barcelona's television network, where she worked for multiple years before transitioning to scripted content. Her professional experience includes companies such as Lionsgate, Anonymous Content, Gaumont and Entertainment One. She holds an MFA from the Peter Stark Producing Program at the University of Southern California, as a recipient of the prestigious La Caixa Fellowship. With a passion for independent film producing with an emphasis on young auteurs and distinct voices, Mireia has produced numerous projects in the US and Europe that have screened in major film festivals such as Outfest or the St. Louis International Film Festival. She is currently developing her first narrative feature film while completing post-production on a documentary feature. She is a Film Independent Project Involve Producing Fellow and a member of the BAFTA Newcomers Program.
